answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
Kudos to you for undertaking this.  Having a program is one thing, establishing performance indicators is taking it to the next level.  Here are some ideas that come to mind.
1.  All employees and board members to attend at least one ethics training per year.
2.  The X Department shall put on a minimum of X sessions on ethics each year including orientation ethics and ethics 101 and 102.
3. The council to adopt and annually/periodically review the ethics policy.
4. Council to establish an ethics award and give out to city employees
5. Annually write an article in the local paper / newsletters letting people know about the ethics policy.
6. Frame and post the ethics policy in prominent places for citizens and employees.
7. Annual contest.

author: Ryan Adams
text:
I am working to build an ethics program within my city and am not finding too much information on effective performance measures that can gauge the success/failure of efforts to strengthen ethics.  Other than the numbers of ethics violations reported and investigated, would anyone be aware of or use other metrics?
Thanks for your input.
title: Ethics Program Performance Measures
